medical
  specialized the process of protecting a person or animal from an infectious disease by putting a substance into the body that makes it produce antibodies (= proteins in the blood that fight disease): mass/routine immunization Immunization gives people the ability to resist infection temporarily or permanently. With the use of immunizations in babies, the mortality rate has dropped significantly.
